text: Hello, I am trying to make a post message for contacts: POST*`/crm/v3/objects/contacts/batch/create`* . I need to add other emails to contacts beside the main email. How can I do it and what property should I use?
<@UFBNA9K9A> Getting 502s on various APIs. Nothing on the status page. any info?
502 is usually from Cloudflare, you have any cf-ray Ids or correlationIds?
Ray ID 8b9cbfbc66a0ceed
Starting to see some other reports start to surface. escalating now to see what might be going on

Hi <@U07JJEQN9CM>!

This is absolutely possible, you'd just need to build some custom logic to:

1. Identify the Deal or Invoice that contains the line items you want to review. This could be generalised or based on specific deal properties. 
2. Use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/line-items#retrieve-a-line-item|line item endpoints and parameters> to grab the data you want. You can find the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/line-items#line-item-properties|list of properties you can call here>.
Hope this helps! :simple_smile:
good luck
<@UFBNA9K9A> We at Unific are also seeing problems
Yeah it’s a pretty wide issue, should have a status page update up soon

So sorry if this has been asked ( I did search :slightly_smiling_face: ) - but I am trying to see if it's possible to get informed via webhook of a call logged for a contact. This and other things (like SMS message sent) seem not to be available as webhook events I can subscribe to, so I was wondering if this was available at another tier or am I just missing something ?

Hi. I’m a bit confused about the HubSpot rate limits.

The documentation mentions that secondly limits are no longer enforced, but we encountered this rate limit error:

```{"status":"error","message":"You have reached your secondly limit.","errorType":"RATE_LIMIT","correlationId":"XXX","policyName":"SECONDLY","groupName":"publicapi:crm:search:oauth:XXXX"}```
Could anyone clarify if we still need to adhere to the secondly limit?

For reference, here are the docs: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>

schedule a meeting with them. Each one works differently.
most like email

why email her? Book a meeting. that’s the best way to create relationships

Hi there <@U07E4JPB9MF>!

The headers you're referencing are probably the deprecated ones and unfortunately we have no way to check that (traffic management) here in the public forum. Per the linked article, it would be best to fire this off in the <https://integrate.HubSpot.com/?_ga=2.234851102.1802613489.1576611619-500942594.1573763828|developer forums> including as much information as possible including what you're using, how you're using it, and which limit you're hitting.

I'm also including the two options HubSpot provides in the docs to attempt if you haven't tried these already just in case they help:

1. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details#use-batch-apis-and-cache-results-when-possible|Use batch APIs and cache results when possible>
2. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details#use-webhooks-to-get-updated-data-from-HubSpot|Use webhooks to get updated data from HubSpot>
Hope this helps! :slightly_smiling_face:
use the link on the idea forum and schedule a time.

Would you be able share where I can find that link? I am still finding my way around HubSpot's Website.
Much appreciated.
It’s on the idea link you posted. :smile:
:+1: I missed it

Anyone know what "displayOrder" on a property in the Properties API actually does? My understanding is that it would dictate the order of the properties on the "View All Properties" page of an object. No matter what I do though (I have verified that the "displayOrder" has successfully updated when making the API request), they appear in alphabetical order. I can't find anywhere in the application where this "displayOrder" is actually setting anything.

To be clear, I am not referring to "displayOrder" on the options of property. That works. I'm talking about "displayOrder" on the property itself. I understand how the property should work (a property with a value of "-1" comes after any non-negative integers, properties are sorted by value ascending, etc.). I'm just trying to understand where in the UI I should expect to see the actual change.
<@U01QVR44MEY> Adding you in case you're familiar with the issue I'm running into. This doesn't seem to actually do anything when I set it.
Hey <@U04EFF323TL>, so actually the view all page will always just do that alphabetically ordering *but* that display order does affect the sorting for the group that the properties is contained in.

In the screenshot you blanked the group out but if you were to check on that group inside of the all properties or if you added the group to the side bar you should see the order changing as you updated that property
So if the flow I went through was {Object} -> "View All Properties" -> {Group Name}, I should see the change reflected? I'm not, unfortunately.
what if you drop that group on the side bar?
Hm. I'm not sure what you mean by that. :(
in the record customization options you can add property groups to the left handside bar:
Ah. I see what you're saying. I'm not seeing it reflected there either.
hahaha, well that's strange
let's me run a check for you real quick
Thanks, man.
always bro
Yeah honestly I just ran all the test and I'm not getting any love from that property
Looks like when the team rebuilt the record page to use the new record customizer those property groups became useless

Hey I'm new to the HubSpot API and I'm trying to use it to create and update batches of contacts. Does anyone know how to prevent a single error from stopping the batch update?

I want to update large batches at once. It's possible one will hit an error. In that case, I want to simply skip the error, note the property the error occurred with, and then move on to the next contact in the batch. I've attached an example where the batch is aborted because one of the contacts in it already exists. I'd rather skip it and move on.

I'd really appreciate any help.
Hi Which property in GET *`/crm/v3/properties/{objectType}`*  tells that the property is required?
